meanings.definition: A small flash or spark of light.
meanings.sent1: The scintillations in the night sky were like tiny stars winking at us.
meanings.sent2: The scintillations of the fireflies lit up the dark forest.
meanings.sent3: The scintillations on the disco ball made the dance floor feel magical.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a scintillation of excitement as she opened the gift.
meanings.sent5: The scintillations of the fireworks painted the sky with bursts of color.

meanings.definition: A brilliant display or lively exchange of wit.
meanings.sent1: The scintillations of humor in their conversation kept everyone entertained.
meanings.sent2: Her scintillations of clever comebacks always left us laughing.
meanings.sent3: The scintillations of banter between the comedians had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: His scintillations of wit were unmatched in the room.
meanings.sent5: The scintillations of intelligence in her words captivated the entire room.
